title: Respecting teachers an obligation: CM Buzdar on World Teachers Day
text:
World Teachers Day is being observed today to highlight role of teachers in development of the country and society.

The theme of the Day this year is “Young Teachers: The future of the Profession.”

Read More: CM Buzdar pays visit to PKLI, inaugurates dialysis unit

Chief Minister Punjab Usman Buzdar has said that teachers enlighten their students with the power of knowledge.

In his message on the World Teachers’ Day, he said that teachers had been given their due status in Naya Pakistan. “Respecting teachers is a collective obligation as they were the pride of the nation and a benefactor of all of us,” he added.

Usman Buzdar paid tributes to his teachers who guided him throughout his educational period and said that teachers played an important role in his life.

Read More: Lahore to be made smart city: CM Buzdar

He said that the nations that gave respect and honour to their teachers won success and respect in the comity of nations.

Today, we should reiterate our commitment that the respect and honour of teachers would be ensured. It was also the purpose of the day to sensitise people about the importance of teachers in the national development, he added.
